DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Post  Thaw Colony Forming Unit  Outcome Total Colony Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numeric value related to the total number of colony-forming unit colonies counted.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Post  Thaw Colony Forming Unit  Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order._The process whereby heat changes something from a solid to a liquid._A unit of measurement of viable bacterial numbers. Colony forming unit (CFU) is the minimum number of separable cells, which is able to produce a visible colony of progeny. The examples of CFU usage include but not limited to the measurement of the number of bacteria present in the environment, and the ability of stem cells to produce cells of single or multiple lineages._The result of an action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredName: Post Thaw Colony Forming Unit Outcome
Property.preferredDefinition: Post; occuring after.:The process whereby heat changes something from a solid to a liquid.:A unit of measurement of viable bacterial numbers. Colony forming unit (CFU) is the minimum number of separable cells, which is able to produce a visible colony of progeny. The examples of CFU usage include but not limited to the measurement of the number of bacteria present in the environment, and the ability of stem cells to produce cells of single or multiple lineages.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
The process whereby heat changes something from a solid to a liquid.

The minimum number of separable cells which is able to produce a detectable colony of progeny. Examples of CFU usage include, but are not limited to, the measurement of the number of viable bacteria present in the environment, and the ability of stem cells to produce cells of single or multiple lineages.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition._A group of cells or organisms grown from a single progenitor._To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity x 10E5 . [manual entered]

A group of cells or organisms grown from a single progenitor.
Determining the number or amount of something.

ReferenceDocuments.name: When the colony-forming units
ReferenceDocuments.description: When the colony-forming units (CFU) were assessed, what was the total number of colonies counted?

ReferenceDocuments.name: BRIDG mapping path for CDE:2730798
ReferenceDocuments.description: PerformedClinicalResult.value(ANY=>REAL) WHERE PerformedClinicalResult > PerformedObservation > DefinedObservation.nameCode = "Count  Total Colony Forming Unit" AND DefinedObservation [total colony count] > DefinedCompositionRelationship > DefinedActivity [composite thaw process] > DefinedCompositionRelationship >DefinedActivity [composite product analysis process] > DefinedCompositionRelationship > DefinedActivity [overall composite HCT process]
